name: RAILWAY CHILDREN INDIA
briefDescription: Railway Children believes in ‘a world where no child ever has to live on the streets’ and it has been working in India since 1996. Currently, RCI is working at 10 railway stations in 6 states (Odisha, Bihar, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Delhi and Uttar Pradesh) and three source areas. Since 2008 to 2017, our programmes have protected 105357 children, including 14054 girls from immediate dangers at railway stations. 67305 children were enabled to access the services of open shelter such as safe stay, nutrition, medical care, counselling and non-formal education. 32153 children were restored with either family or long-term care. 33864 children were enabled to access formal school
